articles.title: Feature: The Boy Who Started It All
articles.author: Fishlegs Ingerman
articles.article: An in-depth profile of Hiccup Horrendous Haddock III, the first Berkian to befriend the dragons. We chat about why he did it, how he convinced a night fury to be his friend, and what he's learned over the last ten years.

articles.title: Playing With Fire: A Look at This Year's Fire-Resistant Clothing
articles.author: Phlegma the Fierce
articles.article: Dragon scales are the new padded leather. We discuss the marriage of fashion and functionality with award-winning designer Dak Dragonbreath.

articles.title: The Isle of Dragons
articles.author: Phlegma the Fierce
articles.article: Not sure where to vacation this summer? Head to Ice Island and spend your days in the company of the most diverse group of dragons on this side of the planet.

articles.title: Train Like a Pro
articles.author: Spitelout Jorgenson
articles.article: Winger Waterdeep shares her top ten training tips. Learn how to gain a dragon's trust, heal cuts and burns more quickly, and keep the gods on your side.

articles.title: A New Season of Dragon Racing Starts Monday
articles.author: Spitelout Jorgenson
articles.article: To the joy of sports fans everywhere (and the terror of village sheep), a new season of Dragon Racing starts next week. This season, all eyes are on upstart rookie Aggro Flame, who made a name for herself in the Huttsgalor farm league.

articles.title: Curing Dragonfart
articles.author: Fishlegs Ingerman
articles.article: Anyone who's spent any amount of time with dragons knows that they're a stinky lot. Veterinarian Magnus Finke shares the special diet he recommends to help ease draconian tummy troubles.

articles.title: The Hidden World
articles.author: Phlegma the Fierce
articles.article: Once thought to be an old sailors tail, legendary dragon trainer Astrid Hofferson recently rediscovered a hidden paradise for many a mythical dragon species. To protect the safety of the dragons, she's not sharing its location, but she did provide us with exclusive paintings of the inside.

articles.title: Identifying Dragon Species
articles.author: Fishlegs Ingerman
articles.article: Does that dragon breathe fire or ice? Is it poisonous? Can it swim or fly? The answers to these questions can be the difference between staying safe and serious injury. Famed biologist Snotlout shares seven things to look for when trying to identify dragon species.

articles.title: By Land or by Sea: Where Should You Train?
articles.author: Spitelout Jorgenson
articles.article: Common wisdom says that over open water is the safest way to train. If you crash or lose control, you land on a softer surface away from towns and villages. But one expert is challenging conventional, and says that training over land can lead to a closer bond with your dragon in less time.

articles.title: Big Changes Coming to Dragon League
articles.author: Spitelout Jorgenson
articles.article: New Dragon League commissioner Leyla Leithgar wasted no time implementing sweeping new changes aimed at improving rider safety. Many are applauding the efforts as long overdue, but some worry that she's gone too far.
